StudyObjective: To apply functional measures of motor learning and plasticity, focusing on white matter activation in the internal capsule during a motor training task.

fMRITasks.TaskDescription: Participants used an MRI compatible mouse to guide a cursor through a marked trail displayed on the monitor, instructed to minimize errors and maximize distance traveled. Performance metrics were recorded based on speed and accuracy, emphasizing the difference in dominant and non-dominant hand proficiency.
fMRITasks.DesignDetails: The task was structured as a block design with seven on-blocks of 24 seconds each, interleaved with jittered rest blocks averaging 24 seconds. Each scan lasted 6 minutes, beginning and ending with a rest block. The task difficulty was designed to emphasize differences in hand proficiency.

BehavioralTasks.TaskDescription: Participants traced randomized trail mazes as quickly and accurately as possible, with performance scores incorporating distance and error-rate. This task was counterbalanced with a matched gross motor comparison task.
BehavioralTasks.DesignDetails: The task was structured as a block design with performance metrics recorded based on speed and accuracy. Each trial involved tracing a complex trail displayed for 24 seconds, with trials designed to be too complex to complete in a single block.
